New Records: Jan Vertonghen's own goal took France into the quarter-finals of Euro 2024, marking a significant milestone in the tournament.
Key Match Events: France edged Belgium 1-0 in a tense tie in Düsseldorf, with the winning goal coming from an own goal by Jan Vertonghen in the 85th minute.
Belgium's goalkeeper Koen Casteels was not tested in the first half, and France had lots of the ball but looked untidy and imprecise.
Theo Hernandez made a brilliant saving block to deny Belgium's William Saliba a goal, and Mike Maignan made saves to keep out drives from Romelu Lukaku and Kevin De Bruyne.
Pre-Game Insights: Both France and Belgium were looking for revenge, with Belgium seeking to avenge their 1-0 defeat against France in the semi-finals of the 2018 World Cup, and France looking to prove themselves after going out in the last 16 three years ago on penalties to Switzerland.
Post-Match Reflections: France's captain Kylian Mbappé was below par during the group phase, and his broken nose in the opening game against Austria did not help, but he still managed to accelerate inside and smash a shot just over the bar.

Belgium coach Domenico Tedesco's reaction to his own side's unconvincing displays in the group stage was striking, and he tried to provide attacking threat with Yannick Carrasco and Lois Openda, but it was not enough to test opposition goalkeeper Mike Maignan.
Miscellaneous Highlights: France are yet to score from open play in four matches at the tournament – captain Kylian Mbappé netted once from a penalty against Poland, while their other two goals came from opposition defenders.
Belgium bow out after what will go down as a disappointing tournament for them.
France will play Portugal in the last eight in Hamburg on Friday, after the Portuguese team beat Slovenia 3-0 in a last-16 penalty shoot-out after a tense tie finished goalless on Monday.
